name: Rajmachi Fort
description: Rajmachi comprises two hill forts—Shrivardhan (~3000 ft) and Manaranjan (~2700 ft)—famous for lush forest trails, fireflies, camping, sunrise views, Kataldhar waterfall and twin fort ruins.

startingPoint.name: Udhewadi Village
startingPoint.description: Udhewadi (Rajmachi village) lies 16 km from Lonavala by forest road or 10 km by Karjat route; it's the base for both forts.

networkAvailability.emergencyContact: 108/112; signal only near village or summit

waterSources: None mid-trail; streams at dry season unreliable
foodOptions: Pack snacks; no stalls en route
recommendations: Carry 3–4 L water, energy snacks, dry fruits

camping.cost: ₹600–700 per person for food + ₹600 per tent

permits.entry: ₹5 per person + vehicle tax (₹100/4‑wheeler; ₹20/2‑wheeler) collected by locals
permits.timings: Trek is open year‑round; camping allowed; night trekking popular but riskier

monsoon.conditions: Lush trails, fireflies, slippery rock sections
monsoon.recommendation: Ideal for campers; caution advised on trail

winter.conditions: Clear skies, cool weather, perfect for trekking

trekRoute.totalDistance: 16 km via Lonavala; 10 km via Karjat route
trekRoute.ascent: 350 m to Udhewadi + ~300 m to Shrivardhan
trekRoute.difficulty: Easy to Moderate; forest roads and paved sections, mild rocky climb

waypoints.name: Shrivardhan Fort
waypoints.description: Main fort with water tanks and view

byTrain.description: Mumbai to Lonavala (local/express); then auto/jeep to Tungarli dam/Udhewadi

byBus.description: MSRTC to Lonavala, then local transport as above

byPrivateVehicle.description: Drive via Mumbai–Pune Expressway, park at Lonavala or near village (off-road required)
byPrivateVehicle.warning: 16 km off-road; high‑clearance vehicle needed monsoon

byTrain.description: Pune → Lonavala train, then same local transport

bestTimeToVisit: October to February (winter); monsoon for fireflies experience
